name: noncontagious
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A non-contagious disease cannot pass from one person or animal to another: a noncontagious disease/infection/condition Valley fever is a noncontagious lung disease caused by soil fungus.
If a person or animal is noncontagious, they cannot pass a disease to another person or animal: Patients who are given the drug quickly become non-contagious.
More examplesFewer examplesPsoriasis is a noncontagious common skin condition that causes red, dry patches of thickened skin.Affected passengers were asked to stay in their staterooms until the virus became non-contagious. Could the hospital cope with a sudden influx of patients infected with noncontagious disease such as anthrax?Health officials say that she contracted a noncontagious strain of bacterial meningitis.Patients with suspected TB are required to remain isolated until they are found to be noncontagious. The noncontagious students who tested positive may have had a latent infection.
